Michigan Ongoing Health & Safety Training Refresher 2023
Section 4: Handling & Storage of Hazardous Materials & Appropriate Disposal of Bio-contaminants 

How do You Dispose of Hazardous Waste in Child Care?

So, how do you dispose of hazardous materials or waste in child care? 

  • Improper disposal can pollute the environment and pose a threat to human health

    Improper disposal of hazardous products can include pouring them down a drain, on the ground, into storm sewers, or in some cases putting them in with the regular trash. The dangers of such disposal methods might not be immediately obvious, but improper disposal of these materials or waste can pollute the environment and pose a threat to human health.

  • Follow the manufacturer’s specific instructions found on the label

    The label for each hazardous product should include specific instructions for how that product should be disposed of. If you do not find the information on the label, do an internet search.

  • Search for your community’s collection process for hazardous waste

    Many communities have collection programs for disposal of hazardous waste to reduce the potential harm posed by these chemicals. These programs may be permanent or periodic. Search for your community’s process by contacting your local environmental, health, or solid waste agency, such as the Environmental Health Division of your local health department. Another means of getting this information is to search for ‘household hazardous waste’ near your zip code in the Earth 911 database. Go to Search.earth911.com. The link to this can be found in the Support Material at the end of this chapter.
